Class Location

java.lang.Object
project2.Location
public class Location
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Location()
    This constructor instantiates each variable to it's base value.
    Location​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description)
    I didn't use this one, but it instantiates name and description to the arguments that were passed.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addDoor​(Door door)
    this method takes the argument door and adds it to the doors ArrayList
    void addItem​(Item item)
    This method adds the argument item to the argument arraylist and prints a receipt to the console
    java.lang.String alreadyVisited()
    This method functions as a toString, but excludes description.
    java.lang.String getDescription()
    returns the variable description
    java.lang.String getDoors()
    this method returns a string consisting of each of the cardinal directions of the doors for this location.
    Item getItemNamed​(java.lang.String name)
    This method iterates through the items arrayList, finding and returning the matching item if it exists, and saying it doesn't exist if it doesnt.
    java.lang.String getItemsinLocation()
    This method concatonates all the items and their info into a string and returns it
    java.lang.String getName()
    returns the variable name
    java.lang.Boolean getVisited()
    returns the variable haveVisited
    Location leaveLocation​(java.lang.String dir)
    This method updates haveVisited to true.
    void removeItem​(Item item)
    This method removes an item from the location.
    void setDescription​(java.lang.String d)
    sets the variable description to the passed argument ensures that the +++ is not included in the description.
    void setName​(java.lang.String n)
    sets name to the passed argument
    void setVisited​(boolean vis)
    sets the boolean haveVisited equal to the argument vis
    java.lang.String toString()
    This method prints out all the Location's data, including all of the stored Door data from the ArrayList

  • Constructor Details

    • Location

      public Location()
      This constructor instantiates each variable to it's base value. haveVisited is set to false and doors is instantiated as an ArrayList

    • getDoors

      public java.lang.String getDoors()
      this method returns a string consisting of each of the cardinal directions of the doors for this location. It is used when determining if a user input can be carried out at the currentLocation
      Returns:
      doorlist

    • leaveLocation

      public Location leaveLocation​(java.lang.String dir)
      This method updates haveVisited to true. it also iterates through the doors ArrayList If a door has the same direction as the argument, it returns that door's enteringLocation.
      Parameters:
      dir -
      Returns:
      Location (the location the door enters.)

    • addDoor

      public void addDoor​(Door door)
      this method takes the argument door and adds it to the doors ArrayList
      Parameters:
      door -

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      This method prints out all the Location's data, including all of the stored Door data from the ArrayList
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object

    • alreadyVisited

      public java.lang.String alreadyVisited()
      This method functions as a toString, but excludes description.
      Returns:
      String (everything except description)

    • addItem

      public void addItem​(Item item)
      This method adds the argument item to the argument arraylist and prints a receipt to the console
      Parameters:
      item -

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem​(Item item)
      This method removes an item from the location. It searches through the arraylist for the desired item, saving it in a placeholder to avoid concurrent modification errors, then it removes the item once found, or prints a receipt that it isn't at this location.
      Parameters:
      item -

    • getItemNamed

      public Item getItemNamed​(java.lang.String name)
      This method iterates through the items arrayList, finding and returning the matching item if it exists, and saying it doesn't exist if it doesnt.
      Parameters:
      name -
      Returns:
      Item stored/ null

    • getItemsinLocation

      public java.lang.String getItemsinLocation()
      This method concatonates all the items and their info into a string and returns it
      Returns:
      concat list of items.
